text: 8 E. A. PIMENTEL AND J.M. URBANOFirst, let be such that Then, there exists such that for every Therefore,  as  Consider next the case of so that Now, Because converges uniformly to there exists such that for every. We conclude that as To treat notice that In addition, by assumption, we conclude that for every as. Therefore, Lebesgue’s Dominated Convergence Theorem ensures that (??) holds true In what regards (??), notice that, for every Furthermore, the assumptions of the proposition yield as. A further application of Lebesgue’s Dominated Convergence Theorem produces (??). The proof of the proposition is then complete. The stability ensured by Proposition ?? will play an instrumental role in our improved-regularity argument of section ??.

<math id="S3.Ex9.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle\left|\left|Du_{\infty}(x)\right|^{\sigma(\theta_{\infty}(x))-2}%Du_{\infty}(x)-\left|Du_{n}(x)\right|^{\sigma_{n}(\theta_{n}(x))-2}Du_{n}(x)\right|" display="inline"><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>σ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>

<math id="S3.Ex10.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle\quad\leq\,\left|Du_{n}(x)\right|^{\sigma_{n}(\theta_{n}(x))-2}%\left|Du_{n}(x)-Du_{\infty}(x)\right|" display="inline"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal"/><mo rspace="4.2pt">≤</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>σ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

<math id="S3.Ex11.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle\qquad\,+\left|\left|Du_{n}(x)\right|^{\sigma_{n}(\theta_{n}(x))-%2}-\left|Du_{\infty}(x)\right|^{\sigma(\theta_{\infty}(x))-2}\right|\left|Du_{%\infty}(x)\right|" display="inline"><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi/></mpadded><mo>+</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>σ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

<math id="S3.Ex12.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle\quad\leq\,o(1)\,+\,C\left|e^{\left(\sigma_{n}(\theta_{n}(x))-2%\right)\ln\left|Du_{n}(x)\right|}-e^{\left(\sigma(\theta_{\infty}(x))-2\right)%\ln\left|Du_{\infty}(x)\right|}\right|\,\to\,0," display="inline"><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal"/><mo rspace="4.2pt">≤</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>o</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo rspace="4.2pt" stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">+</mo><mrow><mi>C</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>σ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∞</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">|</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>→</mo><mn> 0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

<math id="S3.Ex17.m2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle\qquad\,\leq\,\left|Du_{n}(x)\right|^{\sigma^{-}-1}\,\to\,0," display="inline"><mrow><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi/></mpadded><mo rspace="4.2pt">≤</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><msup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>σ</mi><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mpadded><mo>→</mo><mn> 0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

<math id="S3.Ex18.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\left|f_{n}(x)\phi(x)\right|\,\leq\,C\left|\phi(x)\right|\,\in\,L^{1}(U)." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>ϕ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">|</mo></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">≤</mo><mrow><mi>C</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>ϕ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">|</mo></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="4.2pt">∈</mo><mrow><msup><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>U</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

every as. Therefore, Lebesgue’s Dominated Convergence
In what regards (??), notice that, for every

<math id="S3.Ex19.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\left(\lambda_{n}\left(\theta_{n}(x)\right)\left|Du_{n}\right|^{\sigma_{n}%\left(\theta_{n}(x)\right)}\right)\psi(x)\,\to\,0," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>λ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>D</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>σ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>ψ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo rspace="4.2pt" stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>→</mo><mn> 0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>
as. A further application of Lebesgue’s Dominated Convergence
